titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: which is mainly a review of my little collection of sermons called "Notes of my Ministry". It is rather friendly than approving.
I am said to represent, & express, "the point of view of the average lay Churchman
I celebrated after Mattins in the Cathedral. The new honorary Canon, Archdale, was instituted. We lunched with the Archdeacon to meet him & his family.
At Evensong – the special preacher, Alexander from S

Paul's, having failed – I preached in the cathedral, & immediately afterwards motored with my wife to Hebburn upon Tyne, where I repeated the sermon to a congregation of working folks. We motored back to Durham through very heavy rain, & reached home about 9.30 p.m.
